title: How to Breed Silkworms

steps.headline: Get 1-50 plain white and same amount of striped ones.
Feed silkworms with mulberry leaves every couple of hours.
Wait for about 4-5 weeks and they will spin a cocoon.
Now you just wait until they come out as moths.
Put them together and put paper in the container to let them lay eggs on.
After they mate,lay eggs and die,you can put the eggs in the fridge in a sealable bag.
After 2 weeks, take them out and they should hatch in 1-3 weeks.

tyn: Tender, young mulberry leaves (or artificial silkworm food)
Mature, thick mulberry leaves (or artificial silkworm food)
A fine-tipped paintbrush (for moving young larvae)
A second, temporary box (to store larvae while cleaning their main habitat)
A warm location away from direct sunlight
Cardboard toilet paper rolls, newspaper rolls, branches, or other surfaces to spin cocoons on
text: Get 1-50 plain white and same amount of striped ones.  Feed silkworms with mulberry leaves every couple of hours.  Wait for about 4-5 weeks and they will spin a cocoon.  Now you just wait until they come out as moths.  Put them together and put paper in the container to let them lay eggs on.  After they mate,lay eggs and die,you can put the eggs in the fridge in a sealable bag.  After 2 weeks, take them out and they should hatch in 1-3 weeks.  Look after them.
sentences: Get 1-50 plain white and same amount of striped ones.
Feed silkworms with mulberry leaves every couple of hours.
Wait for about 4-5 weeks and they will spin a cocoon.
Now you just wait until they come out as moths.
Put them together and put paper in the container to let them lay eggs on.
After they mate,lay eggs and die,you can put the eggs in the fridge in a sealable bag.
After 2 weeks, take them out and they should hatch in 1-3 weeks.
